problem:
In a sports contest, there were $m$ medals awarded on $n$ successive days $(n > 1)$. On the first day, one medal and $\frac{1}{7}$ of the remaining $m - 1$ medals
were awarded. On the second day, two medals and $\frac{1}{7}$ of the now remaining
medals were awarded; and so on. On the n-th and last day, the remaining $n$
medals were awarded. How many days did the contest last, and how many
medals were awarded altogether?

solutions.Solution: This is not a particularly elegant solution, but if you start from 1 and go all the way in a clever method, by only guessing those that are 1 more than a multiple of 7, you arrive at the answer of 36.
